segments.text: I keep looking at the woman at the sink, utterly lost in her task.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's so focused on polishing that plate, her world seems to shrink to that one object.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it astonishing that she hasn't noticed the gushing water at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is literally submerged in the growing puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: How can she not feel the cold water seeping through her dress or her shoe?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her expression remains so placid, completely oblivious to the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Behind her, the children are committing their small act of rebellion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She's missing all the action, all the risks, everything.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost frustrating to see such profound unawareness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Doesn't she hear the running water, even if she can't see it directly?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout a warning, to tell her to look down!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her calm and the unfolding mess is truly remarkable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's like she's living in her own little bubble.
segments.speaker: PAR
